A friend of mine, Grey Doffin, has a new website selling Reference books and tsuba, misc. please check it out. Grey is a great guy to deal with and well known in sword circles

http://www.japaneseswordbooksandtsuba.com/

mark jones

----- Original Message -----
From: Andres Pedraza
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, November 25, 2011 1:44 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Comptons collection / Dean



Guys,

Please keep posting offers here, too. Not all of us have the bandwidth to
ferret out posts on the NMB, awesome as it is. This group was great
precisely because it all came effortlessly to your email and you could
decide what to read, file or delete.

Best,

Andy

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Comptons collection / Dean
messages.msgSnippet: Brian, Curran, Dean and all, I had meant to write to Dean privately when I read his original message the other day, but got busy with the Thanksgiving holiday.
messages.messageBody:
Brian, Curran, Dean and all,

I had meant to write to Dean privately when I read his original message the
other day, but got busy with the Thanksgiving holiday.

Even though I am 'out of business' as a bookseller, I would be glad to help
out with identification, price suggestions, and any other assistance I can
provide. In some cases I still may have "want lists" from clients who are
still looking for certain books, and I'm glad to do what I can to put
people and books together - that was the real thrill of bookselling.

Dean, in most cases a photo of the cover will be enough for identification,
though in some cases a shot of the colophon page with the publication
information will be needed where there are significant differences between
editions.

The email list(s) are decidedly not the best place to offer books like
these. I don't know what the subscriber counts are, but the nearly complete
lack of traffic tells the story. The Nihonto Message Board is where the
action and the collectors are, for the most part.

I did close my business for health reasons, and my remaining Asia-related
stock is being handled by Paragon Books, but I recently found a few
"stragglers" that I'll be offering on NMB. I'm in the process of moving
over the next month or so to smaller, rented, quarters, but I'm still alive
and interested and willing to help out wherever I can. I recently put
together a Hawley's offered there with someone I knew who had been looking
for a copy.

Dean or anyone can drop me a line or call,

Craig
bridgeofdreams@...
847-846-7701 (cell)

On Fri, Nov 25, 2011 at 11:32 AM, sigp210 <sigp210@...> wrote:

messages.subject: Re: Comptons collection / Dean
messages.msgSnippet: Curran, Don t you think it might be a good idea to get hold of Craig from the Ex-Bridge of Dreams? Although he was recently forced to close his Nihonto Book
messages.messageBody:
Curran,
Don't you think it might be a good idea to get hold of Craig from the Ex-Bridge of Dreams? Although he was recently forced to close his Nihonto Book business, I am sure he is still very good at suggesting prices and would know most of the books. Might even be able to assist with moving many of them or be able to advise.

Brian

--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, Curran Campbell <neobliviscar@...> wrote:
>
> Dean,
>
> Though I was not introduced to your father until late in life, he and I had two wonderful discussions on Bizen blades.
>
> I hope his books go to excellent homes. A pdf of the lot would be good, and I recommend posting it to the Nihonto Message Board as well. If necessary, I will help with that.
>
> Curran

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Comptons collection 3 Auction catalogs
messages.msgSnippet: Understood. I had such a friend in Philadelphia many years ago. He bound a dozen Nihonto books for me. I hesitated to get the Compton Complete Set for many
messages.messageBody:
Understood.
I had such a friend in Philadelphia many years ago. He bound a dozen Nihonto books for me.

I hesitated to get the Compton Complete Set for many years.  Vol 1 is worth it, and probably Vol 2.

Good luck.


Curran

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Comptons collection / Dean
messages.msgSnippet: Curran, Mark, Ron, Thanks.  It will be a while.  I have just gotten off a collection of porcelains, pottery, & other things to IM Chait for auction.  I don t
messages.messageBody:
Curran, Mark, Ron,

Thanks. It will be a while. I have just gotten off a collection of porcelains, pottery, & other things to IM Chait for auction. I don't know when they will be ready. Now I'm looking at what my next task will be.

Dean
Dr. Dean S. Hartley III
Hartley Consulting

106 Windsong Ln
Oak Ridge, TN 37830

(865) 425-9752
DSHartley3@...
http://DSHartley3.home.comcast.net

----- Original Message -----
From: Curran Campbell
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: 11/21/2011 3:27 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Comptons collection / Dean



Dean,

Though I was not introduced to your father until late in life, he and I had two wonderful discussions on Bizen blades.

I hope his books go to excellent homes. A pdf of the lot would be good, and I recommend posting it to the Nihonto Message Board as well. If necessary, I will help with that.

Curran

________________________________
From: Dean Hartley <dshartley3@...>
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, November 21, 2011 11:10 AM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Comptons collection



I have the opposite problem. My father, Col Dean S. Hartley, Jr., left a large selection of reference books, most in Japanese. I will be selling these once I have an idea of what they are. I want them to go to people who will use them. I want to get a fair, but not exhorbitant price for them.

My thought is to take photos of the covers or title pages and make a pdf of the lot. Does this appear to be a useful approach?

Dean Hartley
Dr. Dean S. Hartley III
Hartley Consulting

106 Windsong Ln
Oak Ridge, TN 37830

(865) 425-9752
DSHartley3@...
http://DSHartley3.home.comcast.net

Dear,
is there anybody who can help me for cheaper solution than to buy the "new" 3 books? Used or copy?
Or some download PDF?
I would be thankfull!
Best regards from cold Germany,
Eckhardt

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Comptons collection 3 Auction catalogs
messages.msgSnippet: Herr Eckhardt, I find Fred a difficult negotiator, but you may have better luck with him.    The problem with unbound used copies of these books is that the
messages.messageBody:
Herr Eckhardt,

I find Fred a difficult negotiator, but you may have better luck with him.

   The problem with unbound used copies of these books is that the original ones from Christies had weak glue in the binders. Of many sets, the pages fall out all over the place. If you can find a bound set, it is better.


Curran

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Comptons collection
messages.msgSnippet: Also agree, a good approach. Just remember that this group (nihontostudy) will not allow attachments. Therefore, it might be good to ask for interested parties
messages.messageBody:
Also agree, a good approach. Just remember that this group (nihontostudy) will not allow attachments. Therefore, it might be good to ask for interested parties to request a copy privately. While I do have a good library myself (knew your dad since ~1970) but sometimes in a case like this, something "missing" turns up, to be added to the shelf. Then one day...my children will be doing what you're thinking of doing. :-)

Ron
STL

----- Original Message -----
From: Dean Hartley
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, November 21, 2011 10:10 AM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Comptons collection



I have the opposite problem. My father, Col Dean S. Hartley, Jr., left a large selection of reference books, most in Japanese. I will be selling these once I have an idea of what they are. I want them to go to people who will use them. I want to get a fair, but not exhorbitant price for them.

My thought is to take photos of the covers or title pages and make a pdf of the lot. Does this appear to be a useful approach?

Dean Hartley
Dr. Dean S. Hartley III
Hartley Consulting

106 Windsong Ln
Oak Ridge, TN 37830

(865) 425-9752
DSHartley3@...
http://DSHartley3.home.comcast.net

Or some download PDF?
I would be thankfull!
Best regards from cold Germany,
Eckhardt

Hello Eckhardt -

Yes, this is available...I've answered you privately since it is NSR talk
between us. Hope that email reaches you okay. Maybe I shouldn't have been
private; so little chit-chat online these days with most of these sword
groups. I miss the chatter!

Ron
STL
